meanings.definition: An institution for the care and education of very young children before they enter formal school.
meanings.sent1: Many parents choose preschools to help their kids learn and play.
meanings.sent2: She dropped her daughter off at the preschools every morning before work.
meanings.sent3: The preschools were filled with giggles and colorful toys.
meanings.sent4: In the world of education, preschools are the seeds of future knowledge.
meanings.sent5: The preschools buzzed with the energy of curious little minds.

meanings.definition: The period of time before a child enters formal school.
meanings.sent1: During the preschools years, children learn through play and exploration.
meanings.sent2: Her son's favorite memory was playing in the park during his preschools.
meanings.sent3: The preschools phase is a magical time of growth and discovery.
meanings.sent4: In the journey of childhood, preschools mark the beginning of independence.
meanings.sent5: The preschools stage is like a colorful bridge to the world of learning.
